items.title: Fix redirect test: use httpbingo service instead
items.body:
### Issue Link :link:
postmanlabs/httpbin#617

### Goals :soccer:
This PR replaces the httpbin.org service with [httpbingo.org](https://httpbingo.org) for the redirect test, because currently httpbin's redirect is returning a 404 response.

### Implementation Details :construction:
Change the request URL in `testThatRedirectBlockIsCalledWhen302IsEncountered` from `<HTTPBIN_BASE_URL>/redirect/1` to `https://httpbingo.org/redirect/1`.

### Testing Details :mag:
All tests can pass now.

items.title: Fix build warning for Example project
items.body:
### Goals :soccer:
Fix build warning for Example project, tested on Xcode 12.

### Implementation Details :construction:
- Fix iOS deployment target (change 8.0 to 9.0)
- Add 1024x1024 app store icon (warning: A 1024x1024 app store icon is required for iOS apps)
- Add `CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION` setting (warning: The CFBundleVersion of an app extension ('1') must match that of its containing parent app ('1.0.0').)
- Trun off "Quoted include in framework header" setting (`CLANG_WARN_QUOTED_INCLUDE_IN_FRAMEWORK_HEADER`)

items.title: Use low priority queue instead of background for SCNetworkReachabilityGetFlags()
items.body:
### Issue Link :link:
Close #4223, related https://github.com/Alamofire/Alamofire/pull/3207

Background queues may stop execution altogether in low power mode, so utility mode is recommended.

### Goals :soccer:
This PR changes `DISPATCH_QUEUE_PRIORITY_BACKGROUND` to `DISPATCH_QUEUE_PRIORITY_LOW` (maps to the `QOS_CLASS_UTILITY` class) for `SCNetworkReachabilityGetFlags()` in the method `-[AFNetworkReachabilityManager startMonitoring]`.

### Implementation Details :construction:
`DISPATCH_QUEUE_PRIORITY_BACKGROUND` -> `DISPATCH_QUEUE_PRIORITY_LOW`

### Testing Details :mag:
None, there's no way to test this behavior.

items.title: Improve for-loop observed keyPaths for request serializer
items.body:
### Goals :soccer:

It's better to loop `mutableObservedChangedKeyPaths` directly: change loop count from `AFHTTPRequestSerializerObservedKeyPaths().count` (all) to `self.mutableObservedChangedKeyPaths.count` (actually needed).


Related PR https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/pull/4253

https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/issues/4573

`-setTaskDidReceiveAuthenticationChallengeBlock:` has been renamed to `-setAuthenticationChallengeHandler:` in v4, but the docblock still references the old method name.

items.title: Disable 'Zombie Objects' diagnostics for tvOS scheme
items.body:
### Goals :soccer:
Disables Zombie Object diagnostics for tvOS scheme

### Implementation Details :construction:
Diagnostics shouldn't be enabled by default. Specifically, this causes the framework for tvOS to be build with Zombie Objects enabled when installed using Carthage. Zombie Objects prevent objects from ever being freed up, which means AFNetworking is (potentially) constantly leaking memory on tvOS.

To be perfectly honest, I can't find any documentation stating whether having Zombie Objects enabled in the scheme causes them to be enabled in the resulting binary, and I don't see anything indicating one way or the other. I could be totally wrong in how this is actually handled for release builds. I'm assuming it's safer to disable it, but I'm not certain how to empirically verify that.

### Testing Details :mag:
I just unchecked the "Zombie Objects" diagnostics option in `AFNetworking tvOS.xcscheme`

### Goals :soccer:
Fixed a typo in the CHANGELOG file.

items.title: Prepare 4.0.1 Release
items.body:
### Goals :soccer:
This PR prepares the 4.0.1 release.

items.title: Fix SPM Usage
items.body:
### Issue Link :link:
Original Package.swift introduced in 4.0.0 didn't work due to an improper header search path.

### Goals :soccer:
This PR fixes the Package.swift file by setting the `publicHeadersPath` value correctly.

### Implementation Details :construction:
As explained [here](https://forums.swift.org/t/can-i-use-swift-package-manager-in-obj-c-code/35463/16), the `publicHeadersPath` value is relative to the target directory, not the package file, so it should've been `""` instead of `"AFNetworking"`.

### Testing Details :mag:
Tested manually with a test project that was broken previously.

items.title: Fix ServerTrustError crash.
items.body:
### Issue Link :link:
#4541

### Goals :soccer:
This PR builds on #4542 and #4552 to fix the crash seen when attempting to create an error for a `nil` `SecTrustRef`. It combines both approaches:

- Ensure we only attempt to check the trusts when `[challenge.protectionSpace.authenticationMethod isEqualToString:NSURLAuthenticationMethodServerTrust]` is `YES`.
- When creating an error, ensure proper nullability checks when inserting values into the `userInfo` dictionary, as even in the `NSURLAuthenticationMethodServerTrust` case, the values can be `nil`.

### Implementation Details :construction:
This PR makes the previous 

```objc
static NSError * ServerTrustError(SecTrustRef serverTrust, NSURL *url)
```
 convenience function into an internal method on `AFURLSessionManager`

```objc
- (nonnull NSError *)serverTrustErrorForServerTrust:(SecTrustRef)serverTrust url:(NSURL *)url`
```

to enable testing and adds additional checking internally to ensure no `nil` values are inserted into the dictionary.

### Testing Details :mag:
Tests were added for each permutation of parameters to the new method. To enable this, a `SecTrust` creation function was moved into `AFTestCase` to enable its use in other tests.

items.title: Fix condition of evaluateServerTrust
items.body:
Related to #4542, fixes #4541

We should evaluate server trust only when performing **server trust authentication**.

items.title: Replace instead of appending to the default header
items.body:
### Issue Link :link:

https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/issues/4549

### Goals :soccer:

Currently, `AFHTTPSessionManager` uses `-addValue:forHTTPHeaderField:` to add HTTP headers to an individual request, that will append the value to the existing field specified in the request serializer.

In general, we prefer to replace the default value, instead of appending things to the default value with a comma, right?

### Implementation Details :construction:

This PR changes `-addValue:forHTTPHeaderField:` to `-setValue:forHTTPHeaderField:`. In my opinion, using `-setValue:` is more reasonable and clearer.

### Testing Details :mag:
<!-- Describe what tests you've added for your changes. -->
Tests were added to verify setting HTTP headers per request will replace the default value.

items.title: Fix MobileCoreServices renamed warning, close #4520
items.body:
This warning appears when compiling **iOS/watchOS** AFNetworking installed from CocoaPods on Xcode 11.4.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/526008/77892980-eecffd80-72a5-11ea-891b-78acd78d4b7c.png)

Also from `pod lib lint`:
```
- NOTE  | xcodebuild:  warning: MobileCoreServices has been renamed. Use CoreServices instead. (in target 'AFNetworking' from project 'Pods')
```

**Why no warning on tvOS?**

Because we did not configure `frameworks` attribute for tvOS `Serialization` subspec:

```ruby
  s.subspec 'Serialization' do |ss|
    ss.source_files = 'AFNetworking/AFURL{Request,Response}Serialization.{h,m}'
    ss.watchos.frameworks = 'MobileCoreServices', 'CoreGraphics'
    ss.ios.frameworks = 'MobileCoreServices', 'CoreGraphics'
    ss.osx.frameworks = 'CoreServices'
  end
```

**Why Xcode issues this warning?**

- CocoaPods will add build flag `-framework "MobileCoreServices"` becuase there is `ss.frameworks = 'MobileCoreServices'` in our podspec file. `-framework` flag tells Xcode to explicitly link `MobileCoreServices.framework`.
- From iOS 12, tvOS 12, watchOS 5, Apple moved (merged) MobileCoreServices code (`LSApplication***`, `UTType**` etc) on these platforms to the _new_ CoreServices framework which previously only available on macOS.
- In iOS 13.4 SDK (Xcode 11.4), Apple keeps the MobileCoreServices framework but points it to the CoreServices framework, you may check it out at `/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/MobileCoreServices.framework/Headers`.
- Xcode currently issues this warning to want us to migrate MobileCoreServices to CoreServices.
- You may guess MobileCoreServices will be deleted from iOS SDK in the future.

**How to fix this warning?**

Do not explicitly link `MobileCoreServices.framework`, that's all, no code needs to be changed.

**#import statement**

You can continue to use `#import <MobileCoreServices/MobileCoreServices.h>` or `@import MobileCoreServices;` in your iOS/tvOS/watchOS app or library, before Apple remove the MobileCoreServices framework.

If your app or library is built for iOS 12+, tvOS 12+, watchOS 5+ or macOS, you can just import CoreServices:

```objc
#import <CoreServices/CoreServices.h>
```

Currently, for a cross-platform library or app, you can do conditional importing like AFNetworking does:

```objc
#import <TargetConditionals.h>

#if TARGET_OS_IOS || TARGET_OS_WATCH || TARGET_OS_TV
#import <MobileCoreServices/MobileCoreServices.h>
#else
#import <CoreServices/CoreServices.h>
#endif
```

Or using `__has_include` (may be forward compatibility):

```objc
#if __has_include(<MobileCoreServices/MobileCoreServices.h>)
#import <MobileCoreServices/MobileCoreServices.h>
#else
#import <CoreServices/CoreServices.h>
#endif
```

**Is it safe to remove all `frameworks` attributes in podspec?**

YES!

The auto-linking (CLANG_ENABLE_MODULES) is enabled by default in a Xcode/CocoaPods generated project. And that is why `AFNetworking/UIKit` pod-subspec can be built without specifying `UIKit` and `WebKit` dependencies:

```ruby
  s.subspec 'UIKit' do |ss|
    // ...
    ss.source_files = 'UIKit+AFNetworking'

    ss.frameworks = 'UIKit', 'WebKit' // omitted currently
  end
```

items.title: Improve podspec
items.body:
- Removed unnecessary `submodules` parameter from `source` attribute.
- Removed `requires_arc = true` since `requires_arc` defaults to `true`.
- Removed redundant [`public_header_files`](https://guides.cocoapods.org/syntax/podspec.html#public_header_files): if no public headers are specified then all the headers in `source_files` are considered public.
- Removed `prefix_header_contents`: since v4 requires Xcode 11+, these TARGET_OS definitions become unnecessary.
- Fixed bundle identifier for CocoaPods generated framework: change `org.cocoapods.AFNetworking` to `com.alamofire.AFNetworking`.
- Formatted podspec file: trimmed white space for blank lines.

items.title: Use a synchronous dispatch barrier block for mutable header writes
items.body:
I've been seeing a race condition where the `mutableHTTPRequestHeaders` has been deallocated inside of the block.

This PR pulls in changes from https://github.com/tmm1/AFNetworking/commit/32760e7a3a1cca2817ec498708182ec99584651a and then extends it based on [this comment](https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/pull/3891#issuecomment-544337995).

It should help with https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/issues/3636
and supersedes https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/pull/3891.

items.body: Using`decodeObjectOfClass:[NSNumber class]` to decode an NSNumber object previously encoded by `encodeInteger` will fail.

items.title: Optimizing cancel image download and let task to be canceled really.
items.body:
Now, I'm  using `AFImageDownloader` to download images, When I cancel task with image download receipt, I found the image is still downloaded and the imageCache store the image  successful. So once the task had been canceled, the network shouldn't download this image anymore. 

If each image is not cancelled correctly, it will cause each downloaded image to be decompressed, resulting in very tight memory.

items.title: Fix `NetworkActivityIndicator` kvo call back will trigger twice bug.
items.body:
This is a bug when setter method manual KVOthis will trigger twice KVO call-back! 

1).  From Apple Doc:
```
Given a key that identifies a property (attribute, to-one relationship, or ordered or unordered to-many relationship), send -observeValueForKeyPath:ofObject:change:context: notification messages of kind NSKeyValueChangeSetting to each observer registered for the key, including those that are registered with other objects using key paths that locate the keyed value in this object. Invocations of these methods must always be paired.

The change dictionaries in notifications resulting from use of these methods contain optional entries if requested at observer registration time:
    - The NSKeyValueChangeOldKey entry, if present, contains the value returned by -valueForKey: at the instant that -willChangeValueForKey: is invoked (or an NSNull if -valueForKey: returns nil).
    - The NSKeyValueChangeNewKey entry, if present, contains the value returned by -valueForKey: at the instant that -didChangeValueForKey: is invoked (or an NSNull if -valueForKey: returns nil).
- (void)willChangeValueForKey:(NSString *)key;
- (void)didChangeValueForKey:(NSString *)key;
```


Since our code not use `-observeValueForKeyPath:ofObject:change:context:`, it isn't necessary to trigger KVO call-back manual.

2).  I noticed that [Alamofire/AlamofireNetworkActivityIndicator](https://github.com/Alamofire/AlamofireNetworkActivityIndicator/blob/master/Source/NetworkActivityIndicatorManager.swift) didn't use KVO manual, I think we should keep up with it.

3). Since there are not  expose `activityCount` property, It would be pointless to change `activityCount` value via KVC.

items.title: Delete unused `af_url_session_manager_creation_queue ` when dont support below iOS 8

And the bug [http://openradar.appspot.com/radar?id=5871104061079552](http://openradar.appspot.com/radar?id=5871104061079552) had been fixed in iOS8,  So we should delete the static queue `af_url_session_manager_creation_queue` that isn't been used in `AFNetWorking`.

items.title: Add nullability specifiers to all 'id responseObject' parameters
items.body:
This PR is a follow-up to the discussion + PR happening at #4296, and building/running/adding tests appears to be dependent on #4329.

These changes add `__nullable` specifiers to each location `id responseObject` appears in a method or closure signature, which should alleviate the Swift-Objc interop issues identified in the first PR referenced above.

I'm relatively new to Objc (mostly work in Swift), so please let me know if this is overkill or misses something big - tried to make the smallest number of changes I could while covering everything.

Once the Podfile update PR goes through I'll rebase to get those changes, make sure the existing tests pass, etc. I wasn't sure the best way to add tests for these changes, since they don't change any logic and are instead compiler-related...I could add some basic request tests made in Swift, potentially? But I'm not sure how one would gracefully fail the test if the changes _don't_ work, since they currently just result in an unhandleable crash.

Opening this now so that once the above PRs are done, this will hopefully be ready shortly thereafter. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts. Thanks!

items.title: Fix crashes and memory leaks
items.body:
Good morning guys!

I have some improvements in AFNetowrking that I've done in November and was testing on our app since then. I would love to switch back to CocoaPods version from our fork so I'm opening PR for these Fabric crashes here.

- `invalidateSessionCancelingTasks` should also invalidate session as per name - this means the session has to be able to be allocated again not only in init method - `synchronized lazy loader` looks like best solution
- `session` in load can be taken from `sharedSession` - no reason to create new one by configuration
- `getTasksWithCompletionHandler` has to use `weak`/`strong`

Verified on app with almost 2 mil. active users daily since November 2017.

items.title: Add an ability that notification-observer know which reachability it belongs
items.body:
there exists one problem [AFNetworkReachabilityManager shareManager] is singletonbut it also support that create other AFNetworkReachabilityManager by method managerForDomain or managerForAddress. the two case is opposite.
so if network change, trigger posting AFNetworkingReachabilityDidChangeNotification , receiver can not know which is the actully senderit will get multiple notificationthen the receiver notification method would call multiple times, maybe cause continuously unexpectedly result.

items.title: Safely get mergedTasks On responseQueue
items.body:
There is a race condition in -[AFImageDownloader downloadImageForURLRequest:withReceiptID:success:failure:] that can cause a crash.
#3876

The race condition can be seen with the Xcode Thread Sanitizer on and the project downloading and cancelling images quickly. 
In particular I noticed this downloading images for UITableViewCells and scrolling through the tableView.
#3984 

I think the main issue here is that `mergedTasks` is always updated on `synchronizationQueue` and it is being accessed on `responseQueue`. So there could be a change to the dictionary on a different thread.

* Record the NSURLSessionTaskMetrics on AFURLSessionManagerTaskDelegate and publish them as a notification (See https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/pull/3858)
* Test both methods for publishing NSURLSessionTaskMetrics

items.title: Support for setting headers per request when using AFHTTPSessionManager.
items.body:
It would be nice to have an option to set HTTP headers per request when using AFHTTPSessionManager. 
Currently it's only possible to set the default headers on the request serializer which are used for every request done by the http session manager instance. The problem occurs when you would like to send different headers for different requests which cannot be done in a clean way using AFHTTPSessionManager.
Setting headers per request can only be implemented by using AFURLSessionManager or by subclassing/extending AFHTTPSessionManager, which seems to be inconvenient. 
Also Alamofire library for Swift supports the `headers per request`. It uses a bit different API (without the manager), however, it still seems to be inconsistent.

What do you think?

Let me know if I can clarify anything. You can see a real-world test case here: https://github.com/artsy/eigen/pull/2423/files#diff-99f40649a0fc5dfc78a7014cefddddc5R104

items.title: Exposes C function prototype
items.body: Good morning! I came across a use case in unit testing (see [this discussion](https://github.com/artsy/eigen/pull/2423#issuecomment-330227309) for specifics) when accessing the `AFJSONObjectByRemovingKeysWithNullValues` would be really useful. I'd like to propose exposing this function publicly so that network response stubbing in unit tests can behave as closely as possible to network response serialization in production. Let me know if I can clarify anything  thanks!

items.title: Adding tvOS User Agent
items.body: Adding user agent information to the request serializer for tvOS devices.

items.title: Config AFImageDownloader NSURLCache and ask AFImageRequestCache implementer if an image should be cached
items.body:
### The new feature consists of 2 parts:

- Allow user to config `AFImageDownloader +defaultURLCache`. Currently, the values are hardcoded 20Mb mem, 150Mb disk.

- Provide a hook in `AFAutoPurgingImageCache` so `UIImages` can be filtered before cached. Ideally, one could filter out `UIImage` that exceeds certain *raster* size.

### Use case for this new two features:

A `UICollectionView` shows thumbnails of JPGs. Tapping any `UICollectionViewCell` opens a full size `UIImageView` that displays the full size JPG.

Under thew current implementation, large JPGs boot out thumbnails.
Hence JPGs and thumbnails are downloaded almost always as both caches keep getting recycled.

### References

SO: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41939774/how-to-limit-size-of-image-disk-cache-using-afnetworking/45329948#45329948

See AFNetworking/issues/4009

items.title: Change dataTaskWithHTTPMethod visibility to public
items.body:
Change -dataTaskWithHTTPMethod visibility from private to public.
#2379, #2380, #2404, #2862, #3361

items.title: fix space used in Objective-C method (coding style)
items.body:
1. apple documented coding guidelines, which uses (space after -)
2. fix asterisk location in method declaration
 
https://developer.apple.com/library/content/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/CodingGuidelines/Articles/NamingBasics.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20001281-BBCHBFAH

items.title: Make tests pass again
items.body: This PR makes the security policy tests pass again. Some of the tests have been removed as they are no longer valid; #3979 fixes this by copying in Alamofires test suite (and certificates).

items.title: Allow return value of HTTP redirection block to be NULL
items.body: This addresses https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/issues/3974

items.title: Fix AFURLSessionManager security weakness
items.body:
crashes when calling to a released block pointer

A security weakness was detected as a result of detection by Facebook's infer.
You can trigger a crash by sending nil to the url_session_manager_create_task_safely function as a debugger.

items.title: Fix CHANGELOG formatting
items.body:
* Fix header formatting (requires space between `#` and header text)
* Add missing links to release tags for some older versions

items.title: Fix wrong delegate method in `AFURLSessionManager` annotation
items.body: Fix wrong delegate method in `AFURLSessionManager` annotation

items.title: fix AssociatedObject bug
items.body:
example  UIImageView (AFNetworking)
 in "sharedImageDownloader:"  self is [UIImageView class].
than i have a class like this     UserImageView : UIImageView ,  in "sharedImageDownloader:"  self is [UserImageView class].
[UIImageView class] != [UserImageView class]
so  call [UserImageView sharedImageDownloader] , the objc_getAssociatedObject(self, @selector(sharedImageDownloader)) returns value is always nil.

items.title: Add XMLParser/XMLDocument serializer tests
items.body: Inspired by 290ec35a4a9101322253f05d2c1e1319e9b4b248, this adds tests for `AFXMLParserResponseSerializer` and `AFXMLDocumentResponseSerializer`. This also fixes an error in `AFXMLDocumentResponseSerializer` documentation.

items.title: Search for default pinned certificates in the main bundle
items.body:
Using `[NSBundle bundleForClass:[self class]]` is dangerous because the code will behave differently depending on how AFNetworking is integrated.
- If it is integrated as a static library (for example using CocoaPods), certificates will be searched in the main bundle.
- If it is integrated as a framework (for example using Carthage), certificates will be searched in the AFNetworking framework.

Even though this behavior is documented, this is dangerous. Using the main bundle makes the behavior deterministic.

Fixes #3575

items.title: Deprecate the unused stringEncoding property of AFHTTPResponseSerializer
items.body: The `stringEncoding` property is never used. It was probably inroduced by error in 9a40c0dc0f27e9a547fb173a0b1b5a06072e91f9. It was probably a copy/paste error as the same property also exists on `AFHTTPRequestSerializer` where its actually used.

items.title: Clarify documentation for supported encodings in AFJSONResponseSerializer
items.body: This clarify the data encoding needed for `AFJSONResponseSerializer` to successfully parsing the response as JSON object.

items.title: Enable custom httpbin URL with HTTPBIN_BASE_URL environment variable
items.body: Editing the scheme and checking the `HTTPBIN_BASE_URL` box enables running the test suites on a default local installation of httpbin.

items.title: Add test method to wait for common timeout without handler
items.body:
Since literally every call to `waitForExpectationsWithCommonTimeoutUsingHandler` is passing a `nil` parameter, I think there should be a convenient method for this. 

This simplify the waiting method when doing async test. I have a feeling that people would love this.

items.title: Fixed crash around customizing `NSURLCache` size for < iOS 8.2
items.body:
See #3594.

Rebased with master here to get proper test coverage before merging, and added comments.

items.title: Fixed issue where `UIWebView` extension did not preserve all of the request information
items.body:
This should fix #3724 and any header-related issue in the future.

After this changes, the entire `request`, instead of only the `URL`, will be used to construct the `dataTask`.

Test case is added.

items.title: Fixed bug with webview delegate callback
Disable Background URL Session Tests for Xcode 8
items.body: I've discovered that background url sessions are not very reliable in test targets in Xcode 8. I've disabled them for now, and filed rdar://28588583
